Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya finishes the game with a six, leading India to a 7-wicket victory with 49 balls to spare.
Sanju Samson scored 29 off 19 balls before being dismissed by Mehidy Hasan Miraz.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 29 off 14 balls before getting out.
Towhid Hridoy runs out Abhishek Sharma for 16 off 7 deliveries.
Arshdeep Singh takes the final wicket as India bowls Bangladesh out for 127.
Varun Chakravarthy takes three wickets, including Rishad Hossain.
Washington Sundar gets his first wicket, reducing Bangladesh to 75/6.
Mayank Yadav picks up his first international wicket, dismissing Mahmudullah.
Arshdeep Singh strikes in the first over, dismissing Litton Das for 4.
Mayank Yadav bowls a maiden over on his debut.
Pre-Game Insights: Suryakumar Yadav won the toss and opted to bowl first, expecting the pitch to remain unchanged.
Bangladesh skipper Najmul Hossain Shanto mentioned he would have liked to bowl first as well.

India's playing XI includes Abhishek Sharma, Sanju Samson, Suryakumar Yadav, Nitish Reddy, Hardik Pandya, Riyan Parag, Rinku Singh, Washington Sundar, Varun Chakravarthy, Arshdeep Singh, and Mayank Yadav.

Bangladesh's playing XI includes Litton Das, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Parvez Hossain Emon, Towhid Hridoy, Mahmudullah, Jaker Ali, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Rishad Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, and Shoriful Islam.
This is Bangladesh's first T20I since Shakib Al Hasan's retirement from the format.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gwalior hosts its first international cricket match in 14 years.
